1.text: Boil 1 cup (250 mL) of water in a pot on your stove.

2.text: Stir in 1/2 cup (45 g) of rolled oats and wait for the oatmeal to boil again.

3.text: Reduce the heat to low and simmer the oatmeal for 3-5 minutes until it thickens.

4.text: Remove the oatmeal from the heat and let it cool down for 2-3 minutes.

5.text: Transfer the oatmeal to a serving bowl.

6.text: Combine 1/2 cup (45 g) of rolled oats and 1 cup (250 mL) of water in a bowl.

7.text: Microwave the oats and water on high for 2, then check the consistency.

8.text: Cook the oatmeal for an additional 1 minute if it hasn’t fully thickened.

10.text: Sweeten your oatmeal with brown sugar, honey, or maple syrup.

11.text: Pour a splash of your favorite milk or creamer on top of your oatmeal.

12.text: Top a serving of oatmeal with a pat of butter for a rich, creamy dairy addition.

13.text: Try adding warm spices like cinnamon, cardamom, nutmeg, or ginger.

14.text: Top oatmeal with your favorite fruits for added flavor and nutrients.

15.text: Try your oatmeal with nuts and seeds to add some crunch and protein.

16.text: Put a scoop of peanut butter in your oatmeal for a creamy, nutty topping.

17.text: Stir chocolate chips into your oatmeal to get your chocolate fix.

18.text: Mix about half a scoop of protein powder into oatmeal to add protein.
